newsitem.title: USA: U.S. power output rises 14.2 pct vs. year ago--EEI.
newsitem.headline: U.S. power output rises 14.2 pct vs. year ago--EEI.

text.p: Electricity deliveries in the continental U.S. totaled 71,867 gigawatt hours (GWh) for the week ended Jan 18, up 14.2 percent from the same period in 1996, Edison Electric Institute said.
The amount of weekly power supplied to the South Central region showed the largest gain due to last week's cold snap, up 29.9 percent to 9,729 GWh, EEI said.
New England experienced the smallest rise, at 2,457 GWh up 3.0 percent from the corresponding period a year earlier.
Year-to-date domestic power production totaled about 195,504 GWh, up 1.4 percent from the same period in 1996.
